theme: Administrative and civil service reform,Other economic management,Public expenditure, financial management and procurement

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Economic Governance
            Reform Support Grant Project for Comoros were as follows:
            outcomes were moderately satisfactory, risk to development
            outcome was significant, Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory, and Borrower performance was moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: Technical
            assistance complementary to budget support was, and
            continues to be, key to building the Government capacity to
            implement reforms. It is important to push for core
            institutional reforms in fragile states. Excessive reliance
            on future Public Expenditure and Financial Accountability
            (PEFA) reports to evaluate Development Policy Operation
            (DPO) targets might be counterproductive.
